Description: NVIDIA launched CUDA (Compute Unified Device Architecture), enabling general-purpose computing on GPUs and revolutionizing parallel computing.
NVIDIA unveiled the Tesla V100, featuring the first Tensor Cores designed specifically for deep learning and AI workloads.
NVIDIA announced the H100 Tensor Core GPU based on Hopper architecture, delivering breakthrough AI training and inference performance.
NVIDIA unveiled the DGX-1, the world's first deep learning supercomputer in a box, featuring 8 Tesla P100 GPUs with 170 teraflops of performance, revolutionizing AI research infrastructure.
NVIDIA unveiled the GeForce RTX 2080 Ti at Gamescom, introducing real-time ray tracing to consumer GPUs with the revolutionary Turing architecture.
NVIDIA announced the A100 GPU based on Ampere architecture at GTC 2020, the largest 7nm chip ever built, delivering 20x AI performance improvement.
NVIDIA announced agreement to acquire Arm Limited from SoftBank for $40 billion, the largest semiconductor deal ever at the time. Deal later terminated in 2022.
NVIDIA unveiled Blackwell B200 GPU at GTC 2024, featuring 208 billion transistors with 2.5x better training performance and 5x better inference performance than H100.
